description:
## Theory
Once we know how to map subjects and their class its time to learn how to declare data properties. For this purpose in RML it is used the predicate ***rr:predicateObjectMap*** as shown in the template mapping below.

Each ***predicateObjectMap*** must have exactly one **rr:predicate** to specify the RDF predicate that will appear in the output triplets and exactly one **rr:objectMap** indicating what data from the data source (CSV in this case) should be injected as literal. Notice the objectMap must contain the ***rr:termType*** predicate. Optionally, a datatype can be defined using ***rr:datatype***.
## Hands-on
### Task
Complete the template so that each person has a phone number. Use the data property ***foaf:phone*** with the column **"Phone"**.
### CSV file content
| ID | Name | Phone | City |
|--|--|--|--|
| 1 | "Lily Dickens" | 585-610-2352 | Oneonta |
| 2 | "Chadd Sporer" | +1-352-334-0992 | Iowa |
| 3 | "Katharina Kuvalis" | (272) 642-0684 | Alberta |
| 4 | "Wilhelmine Johns III" | 574.747.4829 | Bock |
| 5 | "Sofia Rowe" | +15204328362 | Elmhurst |
expected_result:
<http://sample.com/resource/P1> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person>;
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Lily Dickens";
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/phone> "585-610-2352" .

<http://sample.com/resource/P2> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person>;
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Chadd Sporer";
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/phone> "+1-352-334-0992" .

<http://sample.com/resource/P3> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person>;
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Katharina Kuvalis";
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/phone> "(272) 642-0684" .

<http://sample.com/resource/P4> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person>;
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Wilhelmine Johns III";
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/phone> "574.747.4829" .

<http://sample.com/resource/P5> a <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person>;
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Sofia Rowe";
  <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/phone> "+15204328362" .
